alert.note: Alert for Mitchell; Osborne; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mitchell, southeastern Rooks and Osborne Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Asherville to near Plainville. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Asherville and Simpson around 1105 PM CDT. Natoma around 1115 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Kansas.
